1.long: just; especially, just in the eyes of God; righteous; the elect (a Jewish idea).
act. and mid: I offer, provide, confer, afford, give, bring, show, cause.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
heaven, (a) the visible heavens: the atmosphere, the sky, the starry heavens, (b) the spiritual heavens.

2.long: (a) prayer (to God), (b) a place for prayer (used by Jews, perhaps where there was no synagogue).
I persist, persevere in, continue steadfast in; I wait upon.

2.brief: I am awake, am vigilant, watch
2.long: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant.

2.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
2.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving.

3.long: I pray, pray for, offer prayer.

3.brief: at the same time, along with
3.long: at the same time, therewith, along with, together with.

3.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
3.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.

a mystery, secret, of which initiation is necessary; in the NT: the counsels of God, once hidden but now revealed in the Gospel or some fact thereof; the Christian revelation generally; particular truths or details of the Christian revelation.
(a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
I bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful.

4.brief: I make clear, visible, or manifest
4.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.

4.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
4.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

4.brief: as, like as, how, while, so that
4.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.
it is necessary, inevitable; less frequently: it is a duty, what is proper.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.

5.long: wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence.
I walk, hence Hebraistically (in an ethical sense): I conduct my life, live.
fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time.
I buy out, buy away from, ransom; mid: I purchase out, buy, redeem, choose.

6.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
6.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
prop: I arrange, make ready; I season, flavor.
how, in what manner, by what means.
it is necessary, inevitable; less frequently: it is a duty, what is proper.
each (of more than two), every one.
I answer, reply, take up the conversation.

7.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
7.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.

7.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
7.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
I make known, declare, know, discover.
Tychicus, a Christian of the Roman province Asia.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.
a waiter, servant; then of any one who performs any service, an administrator.
a fellow slave, fellow servant; of Christians: a fellow worker, colleague.

8.long: I send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

8.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
8.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

8.brief: I come to know, learn, realize
8.long: I am taking in knowledge, come to know, learn; aor: I ascertained, realized.
(a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.
lit: the heart; mind, character, inner self, will, intention, center.

9.long: (originally adj: useful, hence the play upon words in Philemon 10, 11, and very common as slave name), Onesimus, a slave of Philemon, a Christian of Colossae.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

9.brief: from out, out from among, from
9.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.

9.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
9.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
I make known, declare, know, discover.
here, the things here, what is here, what is going on here, the state of affairs here.

10.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
10.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
Aristarchus, a Christian, belonging to Thessalonica in Macedonia.
Mark, who also had the Hebrew name John, son of Mary, nephew of Barnabas, coadjutor of Barnabas, Paul, and Peter.
Barnabas, a Cypriote Jew, uncle of John Mark; his other name was Joseph.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

10.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
10.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

11.long: Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Justus, (a) a surname of Joseph Barsabbas, one of the two nominated to fill Judas' place as apostle, (b) Titius Justus, a Corinthian Christian, (c) surname of Jesus, a Christian with Paul in Rome.

11.brief: from out, out from among, from
11.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
kingship, sovereignty, authority, rule, especially of God, both in the world, and in the hearts of men; hence: kingdom, in the concrete sense.

11.brief: I come into being, am born
11.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.

12.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
12.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
Epaphras, Epaphroditus, a Colossian Christian, in captivity with Paul in Rome.

12.brief: from out, out from among, from
12.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
I am struggling, striving (as in an athletic contest or warfare); I contend, as with an adversary.
gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
(a) prayer (to God), (b) a place for prayer (used by Jews, perhaps where there was no synagogue).

trans: (a) I make to stand, place, set up, establish, appoint; mid: I place myself, stand, (b) I set in balance, weigh; intrans: (c) I stand, stand by, stand still; met: I stand ready, stand firm, am steadfast.
perfect, (a) complete in all its parts, (b) full grown, of full age, (c) specially of the completeness of Christian character.

12.brief: I carry out fully, fully convince
12.long: (lit: I carry full), (a) I complete, carry out fully, (b) I fully convince, satisfy fully, (c) I fully believe.

12.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
12.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
an act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires.

13.long: I witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report.

13.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
(a) labor, toil, (b) pain, anguish, distress, suffering.
gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
Laodicea, a city in the Lycos valley in the Roman province Asia, near Colossae and Hierapolis.
Hierapolis, a city of the Lycus valley in Phrygia, near Laodicea and Colossae.

14.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
14.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
Lucas, Luke, Christian physician and writer of the Third Gospel and Acts.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.
Demas, a helper of Paul in Rome.

15.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
15.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
Laodicea, a city in the Lycos valley in the Roman province Asia, near Colossae and Hierapolis.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

15.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
15.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.
I read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern.

16.brief: from out, out from among, from
16.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.

I read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern.

17.long: (denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
(primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern.
waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration.
I take from, receive from, or: I take to, receive (apparently not used of money), admit, acknowledge; I take with me.

17.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
17.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

18.long: I remember, hold in remembrance, make mention of.
a bond, chain, imprisonment; a string or ligament, an impediment, infirmity.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
